choices.C: Combine multiple conditions in a rule by using both the AND and OR operators.
choices.B: Span the process across 10 unique entities.
choices.A: Merge peer branches to a single stage when merging branches.

questions.question_text:
You are configuring a single business process flow in Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.
You need to design the business process flow.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Deduce this easily
1. Question "what you SHOULD do?" on completely unknown flow.
2. "A" is the only answer where there is possibility to avoid unnecessary steps.
3. Hence "A" is correct answer (...We should not do more)

comments.content: this needs more upvotes. yes A is correct good reasoning

discussion.content: The reference document (provided in the solution) lays out the restrictions that rule out B (max 5 entities), C (can't use both AND and OR together), and D (max 30 steps per stage and 30 stages per BPF)
ok close

Selected Answer: A
Seems close

Selected Answer: A
A IS CORRECT

Answer is A
And and Or operators cannot be combined.
A is the closest answer.
Correct
A is correct answer.
Correct Answer
Only 30 stages allowed

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution. Determine whether the solution meets the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

You are creating agent scripts that have macros for quick steps for agents in a support center.

Agents need to be able to open a case from one of the steps in the agent scripts.

You need to select a type of connector to use to create the macro.

Solution: Configure the macro by using a productivity automation connector.

Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is correct. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/productivity-tools/2-macros

choices.D: Update the attributes that the child case will inherit from the parent case.
choices.B: Create a many-to-many relationship and update the data mapping.

discussion.content:

Answer is correct.

questions.question_text:
You manage a Dynamics 365 Customer Service environment. The company processes thousands of cases daily. Some cases are parent cases, but most are child cases.

When a child case is created, users report that they must re-enter information in fields from the parent case.

You need to ensure that, when a new child case is created from within the context of a parent case, information in specific fields from the parent case is passed to the child case fields.

What should you do?

choices.C: Last interaction for data mapping and automation of topic by using Power Virtual Agents.
choices.B: Last interaction for data mapping and automation of topic by using a bot.
choices.A: Case age for data mapping and automation of topic by using Power Virtual Agents.
choices.D: Case title for data mapping and automation of topic by using a bot.

discussion.content:
Case title is a relevant field for capturing a summary of the issue and using a bot for automation can help in handling topics.
so D seems correct

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/configure-topics-clustering-cases-cs

questions.question_text:
A customer service manager wants to find out how agents describe the reasons that customers call in for support. The manager also wants topics to be automated.

You need to ensure that the manager's requirements are met.

What should you configure?

comments.content:
create, and then "create and activate" is very confusing which would lead to 2 BPF created but only one activated. I vote for 
Create and activate workflow on demand, create new bpf, Activate (without create!) or better yet finalize the BPF with all the stages, add wf and activate at the very end.

discussion.content:
I think the correct answer should be: 2,4,3.

- The Workflow needs to be on demand to enable the the csr to send the email on demand using the workflow:
- The Workflow shouldn't be added "as a global workflow", as you can find in the linked documentation, 
because when adding the worklfow as global workflow it can only be executed when activating or archiving the workflow,
not when entering specific stages.


https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/create-business-process-flow
=> "Add an on-demand action to a business process flow"
=> 10. Add a workflow. To invoke a workflow:


Regards.
This answer is not correct. The workflow should be set to run on-demand,

Ok I agree with the answer but, I could perform the first step as second and the second as first then performance the Third step and the result will be the same. I am not constraint to follow this order of 1st and 2nd step so this question is very tricky…
Answer is : 2-4-3
Which is correct answer?

I think the answers are as stated by majority of the people below. Found this link https://cloudblogs.microsoft.com/dynamics365/it/2017/03/28/business-process-flow-automation-in-dynamics-365/?source=crm hopefully this will support their claims.

1. Create a on-demand Workflow (you Cannot ad a child workflow to BPF)
2. Create BPF
3. Ad to Acknowledgement And Research stage. (Global is not the case since you have to run it on the stage entry).
100%
2-4-3 is correct.
This question was on the exam

The answers are correct. It should not be an On-Demand because the question says the workflow should trigger on entering the stage (that means automatically). For On-demand configuration, the workflow gets added as a button on the BPF stage so that the user manually click the button to start/execute the workflow (which means on-demand you are triggering a workflow).
Hope this helps.

comments.content:
Incorrect - because the workflow shouldn't be added as GLOBAL. Global Workflows are applied when a BPF is Selected, Abandoned, Completed, or Reactivated.... *NOT* when a stage transition occurs.

Therefore the last step should be step 3, not step 5

discussion.content: The given link is not working

comments.content: You can't add a workflow to a bpf that's not created yet.

discussion.content: Why couldn’t the bpf be created first?
correct answer should be: 2,4,3.
Question says that the CSR should be sending the email. So there is no need to put it as background. It must be on demand.
the correct answer 2,4,3. if the workflow is run in the background. you won't need to call it in BPF. will be trigger Automatically.
I believe the order is box 2, 4, 5. In agreeance wih Dude. The workflows needs to but run-on-demand not background

I don't think it's the global workflow area: On-demand global processes. When the workflow is dropped onto the Global Workflows area, the workflow is triggered on process activation or process archival (when the status transitions to an applied, completed, reactivated, or abandoned state).

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service administrator.
Your company requires a new phone-to-case business process flow for customer service representatives to follow.
The stages are as follows:
1. Verification
2. Acknowledgement and research
3. Resolution
Customer service representatives must send an email to the customer when a case enters the acknowledgement-and-research stage.
You need to create the required business process flow and components.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
